str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From peri and histemi; to stand all around, i.e. to be a bystander, or to keep away from.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From kata and phero; to bear down, i.e. overcome; specially, to cast a vote.
Heavy, weighty, burdensome, lit. and met; violent, oppressive. From the same as baros; weighty, i.e. burdensome, grave.
A charge, accusation. From a derivative of aitia; a thing charged.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
From apo and deiknuo; to show off, i.e. Exhibit; figuratively, to demonstrate, i.e. Accredit.
